intro: Psychotria aubletiana f. tomentella, commonly known as the tomentellae form of the sacred plant, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, tomentose leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
